newsitem.title: USA: Sugen sees 2nd half '97 loss diminishing.
newsitem.headline: Sugen sees 2nd half '97 loss diminishing.

text.p: Sugen Inc, a drug development company, Monday said its losses in the second half of 1997 should diminish from the first half's $15.6 million, or $1.20 a share, due to partnering programs in the works.

"If the company is successful with corporate partnering plans for the balance of 1997, we anticipate that our net loss for the second half of 1997 should be less than that reported for the first half of the year," Sugen said in a statement.
The company also said, however, expenses should increase in the remainder of 1997 and into 1998 as some of its drug programs advance toward clinical development or registration.

Earlier, the company reported 1997 second quarter revenues of $1.5 million and a net loss of $8.2 million, or $0.62 a share. One year ago it generated second quarter revenues of $4.4 million and a net loss of $4.5 million, or $0.42 a share.

In the first six months of 1997, the company generated revenues of about $3.0 million. In the first six months of 1996, Sugen generated revenues of $7.9 million and reported a net loss of $8.5 million, or $0.81 a share.
